Comment: Continuation of the May 8, 2013 - Recessed Meeting

Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rev. Msgr. Alfred P. LoPinto, The Roman Catholic Diocese of Brooklyn, 310 Prospect Park West, Brooklyn, NY 11215.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Levin.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Rev. Msgr. Alfred P. LoPinto, The Roman Catholic Diocese of Brooklyn, 310 Prospect Park West, Brooklyn, N.Y.  11215. 



Council Member Levin moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of March 20 and April 9, 2013 be adopted as printed by Council Member Barron.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Barron moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of March 20, 2013 and April 9, 2013 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Erika Larsen - Candidate for designation by the Council to the New York City Youth Board.
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Erika Larsen - New York City Youth Board

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By The Speaker (Council Member Quinn):
Pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and §20-226 or §20-225 of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 622 10th Avenue, Community Board No. 4, Application no.  20135454 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk café, 622 Tenth Ave, Manhattan (20135454 TCM)

Items.Title: Communication from the Speaker
Discussion of General Orders
Reports of Special Committees
Reports of Standing Committees
Report of the Committee on Consumer Affairs

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the mandatory revocation of an amusement arcade or gaming cafe license for offering cash prizes or engaging in other unlawful gambling activity.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Mandatory revocation of an amusement arcade or gaming cafe license for offering cash prizes or engaging in other unlawful gambling activity.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Juvenile Justice

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the administration for children’s services to publish demographic data and incident reports on youth detained and placed in its juvenile facilities, and to repeal chapter 2 of title 9 of the administrative code of the city of New York, relating to the department of juvenile justice.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Requiring the administration for children’s services to publish demographic data and incident reports on youth detained and placed in its juvenile facilities.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign, A.6059-A/S.5932, legislation that would protect student privacy by prohibiting the release of personally identifiable student information without consent.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Protect student privacy by prohibiting the release of personally identifiable student information without consent. (A.6059-A/S.5932)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to notification for renewals of city issued permits and licenses.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology
Items.MatterName: Notification for renewals of city issued permits and licenses.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing the use of biofuel in city-owned buildings.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Increasing the use of biofuel in city-owned buildings.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign legislation to amend the Vehicle and Traffic Law (VTL) to authorize the use of a photographic ticketing system to detect drivers who illegally pass school buses that are loading and unloading passengers.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Amend the Vehicle and Traffic Law (VTL) to authorize the use of a photographic ticketing system.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the price of items sold at newsstands.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: The price of items sold at newsstands.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to enact the “NYCHA Real Property Public Review Act” requiring that any disposition of land or buildings by the New York City Housing Authority be subject to and comply with the provisions of New York City’s Uniform Land Use Review Procedure.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Housing

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to Staten Island ferry service and to repeal subdivision c of section 19-305 of the administrative code of the city of New York, relating to Staten Island ferry service.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign S.3942/A.4380, the “Engineers’, Architects’, Landscape Architects’ and Land Surveyors’ Good Samaritan Act” which would protect from liability professional engineers, architects, landscape architects and land surveyors who render voluntary services at the scene of a natural disaster or catastrophe.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Engineers’, Architects’, Landscape Architects’ and Land Surveyors’ Good Samaritan Act (S.3942/A.4380)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State legislature to pass and the Governor to sign legislation amending the New York State Education Law to afford houses of worship equal access to school property.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Education
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.



The following 11 Council Members formally voted against this item: 

The Speaker (Council Member Quinn), Council Members Dromm, Mark-Viverito, Van Bramer, Brewer, Garodnick, Lappin, Gennaro, Koppell, Mendez, and Koslowitz.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Amending the NYS Education Law to afford houses of worship maximum access to school property.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Department of Education to immediately stop all stand-alone field testing for students.
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Adopted by the Committee on Education
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.



The following Council Member formally voted against this item: 

Council Member Koppell.




Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Department of Education to immediately stop all stand-alone field testing for students.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to enact the “NYCHA Real Property Public Review Act” requiring that any disposition of land or buildings by the New York City Housing Authority be subject to and comply with the provisions of New York City’s Uniform Land Use Review Procedure.
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Adopted by the Committee on Public Housing
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.
Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: NYCHA Real Property Public Review Act.
